Class SimpleFootballPlayerCollectionImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.oop.lab3.implementation.SimpleFootballPlayerCollectionImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SimpleFootballPlayerCollection

    public class SimpleFootballPlayerCollectionImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimpleFootballPlayerCollection
    Class that simulates a collection of football players, implements SimpleFootballPlayerCollection.
    Author:
    Luka

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(FootballPlayer player)
      Adds a player in a collection if he has not been previously added and if there is a space available for a player within a collection.
      int calculateEmotionSum()
      Calculates the sum of emotions from all players within a collection.
      int calculateSkillSum()
      Calculates the sum of skills from all players within a collection.
      void clear()
      Clears all players from a collection.
      boolean contains(FootballPlayer player)
      Checks whether a collection contains a player.
      int getMaxSize()
      Maximum number of players who can be stored in a collection, e.g., if a collection is used to store starting eleven then this method should return 11;
      FootballPlayer[] getPlayers()
      Method used to get the underlying array in which players are actually stored.
      int size()
      Returns the number of players currently stored in a collection.
